# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that solves your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = word
        else
            line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    result *= "\n" * line  # add the last line
    return result
end
```

This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over each word. If adding a new word to the current line would exceed `text_width`, it appends the current line and starts a new one with this word. Otherwise, it adds the word to the current line. After processing all words, it appends the last line.

Here is an example usage:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Phasellus in odio id orci tempus dignissim."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will print the string `s` wrapped to a maximum width of 10 characters per line:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
Phasellus in odio id orci tempus dignissim.
```
